title: Oti147
author: Oti147
content: I am new to the crypto world and still learning the basics to understand how it operates. A friend who is an artist introduced me to NFTs, which he said is similar to Bitcoin. I want to know how NFT drawings can be invested in Bitcoin, but first, I need to understand how to create NFTs that have crypto value. After discussing it with my friend, I searched for help online, but instead of understanding it, I am getting more confused about it.Do NFTs have the same value as Bitcoin? I have read that investing in Bitcoin is a good business opportunity, especially for people in West Africa who may not have many job opportunities. One can be self-employed by trading and investing in the crypto market and assets, including NFTs.As a newbie in the forum, I have read other articles about Bitcoin, but I still need a good guideline on the crypto world, Bitcoin, and NFTs.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: 1. NFT and Bitcoin are completely different, Bitcoin can be used to store a value, currency or not hard to sell since every Bitcoin is same, except you're buy a fake Bitcoin e.g. BCH, BSV, etc. In NFT, you must find a buyer who want to buy your NFT, this is really hard since when you uploaded your NFT to Opensea or NFT marketplaces, there are a lot competitors which upload their own NFT too.2. Using NFT or shitcoins for investing are really a bad idea, honestly NFT is more dangerous than shitcoins.

One can be self-employed by trading and investing in the crypto market and assets, including NFTs.As a newbie in the forum, I have read other articles about Bitcoin, but I still need a good guideline on the crypto world, Bitcoin, and NFTs.I wouldn't compare being "employed" to "trading". Employment takes mostly your time away and not your money (and even if there was, it'd only be spent on daily expenses like transportation and food), trading is completely different. It's a zero-sum game.  You have to have something you can lose before you gain something, in this case, money. Anw on the topic of NFT and Bitcoin, they're different. Bitcoin is a cryptocurrency, to simplify, it's a type of money you can use like how you use say USD (or whatever local currency you use). Emphasis on "like" since they still have differences. NFT's are like a "token" that certifies ownership. Just imagine it as a type of deed for that certain object, in most cases right now, it's for a piece of art.

And choose different properties for them, then you choose a blockchain and pay the fees for creating your nft.You asked that do they have same value as Bitcoin? You can think this as etsy shop. You can try to sell anything with any price. But the question you need to ask from yourself is: Why would anyone buy the nfts you did?An example: I made this banana as nft for a test:Now i could set up a sell order for it and name the price. But why would anyone buy it? Even it was a special banana? But my explanation was not about nft collections. Those are basically same thing except you mint (buy) them without seeing what you get and they have a reveal day when you get to know what sort of pic you got.That's more complex procedure and someone else can tell about it if they have time. However the whole web is full of tutorials.

comments.author: ije07
comments.body: NFT is a work of art that was created in 2017 and could be a very rare asset because it does not have the same value as other NFTs. Although NFT was created on the blockchain, the NFT exchange rate is very different from the others because NFT has its own signature while on Bitcoin and has the same exchange value when on sale.Because it is easy to convert documents to NFT, when you want to invest in NFT, be careful again and always do research on a NFT project before investing.

comments.body: Despite the fact that they are from the same family, I do not believe they have the same value. Bitcoin is more valuable than NFTs because more people recognize bitcoin than NFTs.Someone can own a bitcoin even if it is the same unit, whereas they can own NFTs in smaller units other than a whole number.

They are stored on a blockchain, which is a decentralized public ledger that records transactions and ownership information.If you believe that a particular NFT drawing has significant value and potential for appreciation, you can purchase it with cryptocurrency or fiat currency and hold onto it in hopes of selling it at a profit in the future. However, investing in NFTs can be risky, as the market is still relatively new and volatile.

comments.author: JayTrain
comments.body: Comparing NFTs to Bitcoin is like comparing apples to oranges. Both have their own unique value propositions and uses cases in the blockchain space. While Bitcoin is primarily a store of value and a means of exchange, NFTs are more focused on the ownership and provenance of digital assets. It's important to evaluate each asset class on its own merits rather than trying to compare them directly
